name: random
description: A Pulumi package to safely use randomness in Pulumi programs.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`random` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/terraform-providers/terraform-provider-random).

provider.description:
The provider type for the random package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

random:index/randomId:RandomId.description:
The resource `random.RandomId` generates random numbers that are intended to be
used as unique identifiers for other resources.

This resource *does* use a cryptographic random number generator in order
to minimize the chance of collisions, making the results of this resource
when a 16-byte identifier is requested of equivalent uniqueness to a
type-4 UUID.

This resource can be used in conjunction with resources that have
the `create_before_destroy` lifecycle flag set to avoid conflicts with
unique names during the brief period where both the old and new resources
exist concurrently.

b64.deprecationMessage: Use b64_url for old behavior, or b64_std for standard base64 encoding

b64Std.description: The generated id presented in base64 without additional transformations.

b64Url.description: The generated id presented in base64, using the URL-friendly character set: case-sensitive letters, digits and the characters `_` and `-`.

byteLength.description:
The number of random bytes to produce. The
minimum value is 1, which produces eight bits of randomness.

dec.description: The generated id presented in non-padded decimal digits.

hex.description: The generated id presented in padded hexadecimal digits. This result will always be twice as long as the requested byte length.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

prefix.description:
Arbitrary string to prefix the output value with. This
string is supplied as-is, meaning it is not guaranteed to be URL-safe or
base64 encoded.

byteLength.description:
The number of random bytes to produce. The
minimum value is 1, which produces eight bits of randomness.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

prefix.description:
Arbitrary string to prefix the output value with. This
string is supplied as-is, meaning it is not guaranteed to be URL-safe or
base64 encoded.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomId resources.

b64.deprecationMessage: Use b64_url for old behavior, or b64_std for standard base64 encoding

b64Url.description: The generated id presented in base64, using the URL-friendly character set: case-sensitive letters, digits and the characters `_` and `-`.

The number of random bytes to produce. The
minimum value is 1, which produces eight bits of randomness.

dec.description: The generated id presented in non-padded decimal digits.

random:index/randomInteger:RandomInteger.description:
The resource `random.RandomInteger` generates random values from a given range, described by the `min` and `max` attributes of a given resource.

This resource can be used in conjunction with resources that have
the `create_before_destroy` lifecycle flag set, to avoid conflicts with
unique names during the brief period where both the old and new resources
exist concurrently.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

max.description: The maximum inclusive value of the range.

min.description: The minimum inclusive value of the range.

seed.description: A custom seed to always produce the same value.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

max.description: The maximum inclusive value of the range.

min.description: The minimum inclusive value of the range.

seed.description: A custom seed to always produce the same value.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomInteger resources.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

max.description: The maximum inclusive value of the range.

min.description: The minimum inclusive value of the range.

seed.description: A custom seed to always produce the same value.

random:index/randomPassword:RandomPasswo.description:
Identical to the `random.RandomString` resource with the exception that the
result is treated as sensitive and, thus, _not_ displayed in console output.

> **Note:** All attributes including the generated password will be stored in
the raw state as plain-text.

This resource *does* use a cryptographic random number generator.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomPassword resources.

random:index/randomPet:RandomPet.description:
The resource `random.RandomPet` generates random pet names that are intended to be
used as unique identifiers for other resources.

This resource can be used in conjunction with resources that have
the `create_before_destroy` lifecycle flag set, to avoid conflicts with
unique names during the brief period where both the old and new resources
exist concurrently.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

length.description: The length (in words) of the pet name.

prefix.description: A string to prefix the name with.

separator.description: The character to separate words in the pet name.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

length.description: The length (in words) of the pet name.

prefix.description: A string to prefix the name with.

separator.description: The character to separate words in the pet name.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomPet resources.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

length.description: The length (in words) of the pet name.

prefix.description: A string to prefix the name with.

separator.description: The character to separate words in the pet name.

random:index/randomShuffle:RandomShuffle.description:
The resource `random.RandomShuffle` generates a random permutation of a list
of strings given as an argument.

inputs.description: The list of strings to shuffle.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

resultCount.description:
The number of results to return. Defaults to
the number of items in the `input` list. If fewer items are requested,
some elements will be excluded from the result. If more items are requested,
items will be repeated in the result but not more frequently than the number
of items in the input list.

results.description: Random permutation of the list of strings given in `input`.

seed.description:
Arbitrary string with which to seed the random number
generator, in order to produce less-volatile permutations of the list.
**Important:** Even with an identical seed, it is not guaranteed that the
same permutation will be produced across different versions of the provider.
This argument causes the result to be *less volatile*, but not fixed for
all time.

inputs.description: The list of strings to shuffle.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

resultCount.description:
The number of results to return. Defaults to
the number of items in the `input` list. If fewer items are requested,
some elements will be excluded from the result. If more items are requested,
items will be repeated in the result but not more frequently than the number
of items in the input list.

seed.description:
Arbitrary string with which to seed the random number
generator, in order to produce less-volatile permutations of the list.
**Important:** Even with an identical seed, it is not guaranteed that the
same permutation will be produced across different versions of the provider.
This argument causes the result to be *less volatile*, but not fixed for
all time.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomShuffle resources.

inputs.description: The list of strings to shuffle.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

resultCount.description:
The number of results to return. Defaults to
the number of items in the `input` list. If fewer items are requested,
some elements will be excluded from the result. If more items are requested,
items will be repeated in the result but not more frequently than the number
of items in the input list.

results.description: Random permutation of the list of strings given in `input`.

seed.description:
Arbitrary string with which to seed the random number
generator, in order to produce less-volatile permutations of the list.
**Important:** Even with an identical seed, it is not guaranteed that the
same permutation will be produced across different versions of the provider.
This argument causes the result to be *less volatile*, but not fixed for
all time.

random:index/randomString:RandomString.description:
The resource `random.RandomString` generates a random permutation of alphanumeric
characters and optionally special characters.

This resource *does* use a cryptographic random number generator.

Historically this resource's intended usage has been ambiguous as the original example
used it in a password. For backwards compatibility it will
continue to exist. For unique ids please use the `random.RandomId` resource, for sensitive
random values please use the `random.RandomPassword` resource.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new id to be generated.

length.description: The length of the string desired

lower.description:
(default true) Include lowercase alphabet characters
in random string.

minLower.description:
(default 0) Minimum number of lowercase alphabet
characters in random string.

minNumeric.description:
(default 0) Minimum number of numeric characters
in random string.

minSpecial.description:
(default 0) Minimum number of special characters
in random string.

minUpper.description:
(default 0) Minimum number of uppercase alphabet
characters in random string.

number.description:
(default true) Include numeric characters in random
string.

overrideSpecial.description:
Supply your own list of special characters to
use for string generation.  This overrides the default character list in the special
argument.  The special argument must still be set to true for any overwritten
characters to be used in generation.

special.description:
(default true) Include special characters in random
string. These are `!@#$%&*()-_=+[]{}<>:?`

upper.description:
(default true) Include uppercase alphabet characters
in random string.

random:index/randomUuid:RandomUuid.description:
The resource `random.RandomUuid` generates random uuid string that is intended to be
used as unique identifiers for other resources.

This resource uses the `hashicorp/go-uuid` to generate a UUID-formatted string
for use with services needed a unique string identifier.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new uuid to be generated.

result.description: The generated uuid presented in string format.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new uuid to be generated.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering RandomUuid resources.

keepers.description:
Arbitrary map of values that, when changed, will
trigger a new uuid to be generated.

result.description: The generated uuid presented in string format.
